oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Corner of First Avenue North and Church Street architectural survey, 1980
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Architecture; Buildings; Business; Capitol City; Downtown Nashville; Architectural surveys--Tennessee--Nashville; Architecture--Details; Architecture--Tennessee--Nashville; Architecture, Victorian--Tennessee--Nashville; Buildings--Tennessee--Nashville; Central business districts--Tennessee--Nashville; Commercial buildings--Tennessee--Nashville; Historic buildings--Tennessee--Nashville; Historic districts--Tennessee--Nashville; Historic preservation--Tennessee--Nashville; History--Societies, etc.--Tennessee--Nashville
Nashville (Tenn.)--Buildings, structures, etc.; Nashville (Tenn.)--History--Sources; First Avenue (Nashville, Tenn.); Church Street (Nashville, Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Detailed architectural and historical survey of the building located on the southwest corner of First Avenue North and Church Street,consisting of photographs and documents created in 1980. Black and white photographs show the Church Street side of the building, in almost its full entirety. Documents contain architectural descriptions. This building was built around 1910. It is made of brick and is four stories tall. Forms part of Historic Nashville Inc. Downtown Survey, Series I. Downtown Survey.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Historic Nashville, Inc.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church St., Nashville, Tennessee 37219
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Historic Nashville, Inc. Downtown Survey, Series I. Downtown Survey
